channel.title: My starter kit. [PI]
channel.description: My starters-kit isn't working like it's suppose to be. Anyone know what i should check?

item.title: My starter kit. [PI]
item.dc:creator: @Aetoc Aetoc
item.description:
@Aetoc wrote:

[quote=“All Time Low, post:9, topic:442706”]I don’t know what else to say.
I can code java been coding for 3-4 month’s.
I add 15m to the starter kit and when a new player logs in they still don’t get the 15m.
What else do i need to say? :[/quote]

Well they would like to see the code, probably in client.java where your starter code is so they can tell you where the problem lies and how to fix it.

Read full topic

item.title: My starter kit. [PI]
item.dc:creator: @Skiire Skiire
item.description:
@Skiire wrote:

All Time Low:

Players aren’t receiving the 15m i inserted for the starter kit.

From that statement we can assume that you’re trying to play your server while your computer is turned off and that’s why it’s not working… Please refer to rule 2 of the server help board and read this quote:

A large majority of topics in this section are not explained very well, easily seen by the first few posters asking to elaborate. From now on, if you fail to be as specific as possible, your topic may be locked. It is a complete waste of time for those who are trying to help if they have to post asking for you to elaborate. So, if it means pictures, samples of code, and anything else you believe may be helpful to people who are trying to answer your question.

Just remember, the better you explain the problem you are experiencing, the better quality the replied posts will be, and the faster your issue will be resolved.

You have given us, the server board helpees, nothing in order to appropriately address and begin to work on your problem. Imagine this: I call the doctors office to tell them I’m sick and when they ask what my symptoms are I respond with, “I feel bad.”

Read full topic

item.title: My starter kit. [PI]
item.dc:creator: @ravekitty ravekitty
item.description:
@ravekitty wrote:

If it’s not adding when a player joins.
Then search “addstarter” inclient.java
and somewhere under

Misc.println("[REGISTERED]: "+playerName+"");
add [code] if (addStarter) getPA().addStarter(); [/code] I don't know what else could be wrong with it though.

Read full topic
